extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule(GrammarSymbol leftVariable,
            java.util.List<GrammarSymbol> rightSymbols)
        Creates a rule from its two parts. We made the assumption that the left-hand part of a rule is composed of ony and only one variable.
        Parameters:
        leftVariable - Left-hand variable
        rightSymbols - Right-hand sequence of symbols

      • Rule

        public Rule(java.lang.String leftVariable,
            java.lang.String[] rightSymbols)
        Creates a rule from symbols names
        Parameters:
        leftVariable - Name of left-hand variable
        rightSymbols - Names of symbols in right-hand part

    • Method Detail

      • removePrefix

        public Rule removePrefix(java.lang.Integer prefixSize)
        Returns new rule containing the same variable as left-hand part, and a new right-hand part with prefix removed.
        Parameters:
        prefixSize - The size of the prefix to remove from right-hand part

      • contains

        public boolean contains(GrammarSymbol symbol)
        Tells whether the rule contains the given symbol as the left-hand variable or in the right-hand part.
        Parameters:
        symbol - Symbol to look for

      • isLeftRecursive

        public boolean isLeftRecursive()
        Tells whether the rule if left-recursive all by itself

      • removeLeftRecursion

        public void removeLeftRecursion(java.lang.String nonLeftRecursiveSuffix,
                                java.lang.String leftRecursiveSuffix)
        Removes left-recursion after checking that the rule if left-recursive all by itself.
        Parameters:
        nonLeftRecursiveSuffix - New left-hand variable name to use in case where the rule is not left-recursive
        leftRecursiveSuffix - New left-hand variable name to use in case where the rule is left-recursive

      • getGrammarSymbols

        public java.util.Set<GrammarSymbol> getGrammarSymbols(boolean getV,
                                                      boolean getT)
        Helper function that returns the rule symbols as a single set. Depending on arguments, it can return either the set of variables, the set of terminals or the set of symbols
        Parameters:
        getV - Whether to include variables or not
        getT - Whether to include terminals or not

      • getVariables

        public java.util.Set<GrammarSymbol> getVariables()
        Returns the set of variables in the rule

      • getTerminals

        public java.util.Set<GrammarSymbol> getTerminals()
        Returns the set of terminals in the rule

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares rules using their two parts (in worst case) or only their left variable
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of the rule
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toPrettyString

        public java.lang.String toPrettyString(boolean showLeftVariable,
                                       java.lang.Integer padding)
        Pretty string representation of the rule.
        Parameters:
        showLeftVariable - Whether to add left-hand variable or not. This argument is useful for displaying the grammar, with adjacent rules that have the same left-hand variable
        padding - Number of padding spaces

      • toLatex

        public java.lang.String toLatex(boolean showLeftVariable)
        String representation of the rule, adapted for LaTex. It is very similar to the toPrettyString method.
        Parameters:
        showLeftVariable - Whether to add left-hand variable or not.
        See Also:
        toPrettyString

      • getLeftVariable

        public GrammarSymbol getLeftVariable()
        Get left-hand variable of the rule

      • getRightSymbols

        public java.util.List<GrammarSymbol> getRightSymbols()
        Get right-hand sequence of symbols
